resources.string: Vito Acconci designed a steel grid structure in the shape of a half-opened shell. The open part an amphitheatre for performances but also a resting place for sun-seekers. The covered part a very trendy café.
Two great museums reflecting the historical and modern art in Graz. The Armoury museum is the world’s largest collection of medieval arms and armous.
A journey into the Cosmos. A building portraying time. That is how one could describe Schloss Eggenberg, erected in 1625-56.
An amazing Restaurant on the Schlossberg with an exhilarating view over the rooftops. A breathtaking view, an ocean of fragrance.
Speisesaal whets the appetite for dishes as international as a frequent flier account. Reservations recommended!
Here guests are both enchanted and surprised by a mixture of Austrian and Mediterranean delicacies, interspersed with occasional tasters.

Three Monkeys is located in Elisabethstraße in the university quarter, a popular area for young people to meet. In this legendary basement pub the guests are 21 and over, a mix of „young but grown up".

The ppc (project pop culture) with its 300 events per year is THE leading venue for pop culture in Graz. Internationally famed groups perform on two floors in the genres of „Rock“, „Indie“, „Electronic“ and „HipHop“
or years now the „Orange“ has been known for its international DJs, as well as for the combination of a cool cafe (breakfast served until 4 PM) and a great club.

"A hotel is not simply a hotel." Some are happy with room and board while others expect a little more than a place to sleep with bathroom in a central position.But They have the right room for everyone.

12 seminar rooms designed for flexibility, 83 comfortable rooms and an in-house seminar assistant… and above all, a can-do attitude - the motto at the Paradies is “nothing is impossible”, guaranteeing the success of your event.
This hotel offers 150 years of tradition. The hotel combines style, ease and comfort reflected in the individually arranged rooms and suites of the former baroque palace.
